material-property-value-condition.content:
Please analyze the following paragraph and summarize the properties, including their numerical values, of the mentioned materials.

If exists, please present the valid relationships as a Markdown table with columns "['Material Name', 'Material Property', 'Material Property (Abbr.)', 'Numerical Value', 'Condition']". Make sure the table items are from the original paragraph.

Paragraph: To investigate the morphology of the polymer / PCBM blend film , atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) was performed , and the result is shown in Figure 6. In Figure 6a , microphase separation occurred between the polymer and PC71BM , while the polymer formed a small fibril - type domain at a 1 : 1 PQCDTB / PC71BM ratio. As shown in Figure 6c , the fibril domain or microphase separation was clearer when measured at a 1 × 1 μm 2 size. It appears that this type of fibril domain occurred because PQCDTB formed effective π-π stacking based on outstanding crystallinity. 31 As shown in Figure 6b , in contrast , when the PQCDTB / PC71BM ratio was 1 : 2 , the polymers were assembled , and a large domain was formed. As a result , a relatively large - size phase separation took place. As shown in Figure 6d , the large domain or the large - size phase separation was clearer when measured at a 1 × 1 μm 2 size. The large - phase separation exhibits a low photocurrent by reducing the charge separation and increasing the exciton diffusion length and the recombination of electric charges. 32 Therefore , at a 1 : 2 polymer / PC71BM ratio , a large phase separation occurs between the polymer and the PC71BM. As a result , a low photocurrent would occur ; this is comparable to the 1 : 1 ratio. The same results were confirmed for the current device using the data in Table 3. Similar results were observed between PQCDTB and PC61BM as well. When the PCZDTB : PC71BM ratio was 1 : 4 , a smooth morphology was detected , and no fibril domain was observed , just like the PQCDTB , because the self - organization of PCZDTB is lower than that of PQCDTB. 9 In this study , PQCDTB has been successfully synthesized through the Suzuki coupling reaction by introducing planar quinacridone unit and a broad - absorption benzothiadiazole unit. PQCDTB had a high molecular weight and good thermal stability. Because of the appropriate HOMO and LUMO energy levels , an effective balance was produced. According to the X-ray diffraction measurement , a broad diffraction peak was observed at approximately 24.0 ° . In terms of the π-π stacking distance ( d π ) , a significantly shorter distance ( 3.7 Å ) was observed. These values were similar to the results of the thiophene and thiophenefused aromatic system polymers. When the PQCDTB : PC71BM ratio was 1 : 1 , the highest efficiency was detected , and V OC , J SC , FF , and PCE were 0.79 V , 5.6 mA cm^-2 , 55.8% , and 2.5% , respectively. When the PQCDTB : PC71BM ratio was 1 : 1 , the polymer formed a fibril - type domain and microphase separation occurred between the polymer and PC71BM. Because of selforganization , PQCDTB showed a higher FF compared with PCZDTB.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name | Material Property | Material Property (Abbr.) | Numerical Value | Condition |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| Polymer / PCBM blend film | Morphology | - | - | AFM measurement |
| Polymer and PC71BM | Microphase separation | - | Occurs | At 1:1 PQCDTB / PC71BM ratio |
| Polymer | Fibril-type domain | - | Formed | At 1:1 PQCDTB / PC71BM ratio |
| PQCDTB | π-π stacking | - | Effective | Based on outstanding crystallinity |
| Polymer | Large domain | - | Formed | At 1:2 PQCDTB / PC71BM ratio |
| Polymer and PC71BM | Large-size phase separation | - | Occurs | At 1:2 polymer / PC71BM ratio |
| Polymer and PC71BM | Low photocurrent | - | Occurs | As a result of large-size phase separation |
| PQCDTB and PC61BM | Similar results | - | Observed | - |
| PQCDTB | High molecular weight | MW | High | - |
| PQCDTB | Thermal stability | - | Good | - |
| PQCDTB | HOMO energy level | HOMO | Appropriate | - |
| PQCDTB | LUMO energy level | LUMO | Appropriate | - |
| PQCDTB and PC71BM | Efficiency | PCE | 2.5% | At 1:1 PQCDTB : PC71BM ratio |
| PQCDTB and PC71BM | Voc | Voc | 0.79 V | At 1:1 PQCDTB : PC71BM ratio |
| PQCDTB and PC71BM | Jsc | Jsc | 5.6 mA/cm^2 | At 1:1 PQCDTB : PC71BM ratio |
| PQCDTB and PC71BM | FF | FF | 55.8% | At 1:1 PQCDTB : PC71BM ratio |
| PQCDTB | π-π stacking distance | dπ | 3.7 Å | - |
| PQCDTB | Broad diffraction peak | - | Observed | At approximately 24.0° |

Note:

* AFM: Atomic Force Microscopy
* PQCDTB: A specific type of polymer
* PCBM: Phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester
* PC71BM: Phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester
* PC61BM: Phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester
* HOMO: Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital
* LUMO: Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital
* Voc: Open-circuit voltage
* Jsc: Short-circuit current density
* FF: Fill factor
* PCE: Power conversion efficiency
